MemberSignature.Value: public static Iot.Device.Nmea0183.Ais.MovingTarget EstimatePosition (this Iot.Device.Nmea0183.Ais.MovingTarget ship, DateTimeOffset time, TimeSpan stepSize);

.method public static hidebysig class Iot.Device.Nmea0183.Ais.MovingTarget EstimatePosition(class Iot.Device.Nmea0183.Ais.MovingTarget ship, valuetype System.DateTimeOffset time, valuetype System.TimeSpan stepSize) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Function EstimatePosition (ship As MovingTarget, time As DateTimeOffset, stepSize As TimeSpan) As MovingTarget
static member EstimatePosition : Iot.Device.Nmea0183.Ais.MovingTarget * DateTimeOffset * TimeSpan -> Iot.Device.Nmea0183.Ais.MovingTarget

Docs.param: The ship to extrapolate
The time at which the position shall be estimated. The estimate is better the closer this time is to the last position of the ship.
The extrapolation step size. Smaller values will lead to better estimation, but are computationally expensive
Docs.summary: Estimates where a ship will at a certain time.
Docs.returns: A instance with the estimated position and course

MemberSignature.Value: public static Iot.Device.Nmea0183.Ais.MovingTarget EstimatePosition (this Iot.Device.Nmea0183.Ais.MovingTarget ship, TimeSpan extrapolationTime, TimeSpan stepSize);

.method public static hidebysig class Iot.Device.Nmea0183.Ais.MovingTarget EstimatePosition(class Iot.Device.Nmea0183.Ais.MovingTarget ship, valuetype System.TimeSpan extrapolationTime, valuetype System.TimeSpan stepSize) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Function EstimatePosition (ship As MovingTarget, extrapolationTime As TimeSpan, stepSize As TimeSpan) As MovingTarget
static member EstimatePosition : Iot.Device.Nmea0183.Ais.MovingTarget * TimeSpan * TimeSpan -> Iot.Device.Nmea0183.Ais.MovingTarget

Docs.param: The ship to extrapolate
How much time shall pass. Very large values are probably useless, because the ship might start a turn.
The extrapolation step size. Smaller values will lead to better estimation, but are computationally expensive
Docs.summary: Estimates where a ship will be after some time.
Docs.returns: A instance with the estimated position and course
Docs.remarks: The reference time is the position/time the last report was received from this ship. To be able to compare two ships, the times still need to be aligned. Use the overload if you want to estimate the ship position at a certain position in time.

Docs.param: The ship to move
The time at which the track should start (may be in the past)
The time at which the track should end
The step size of the returned track
Docs.summary: Calculate a track estimation for a ship
Docs.returns: A list of targets (for each estimated position from to ).
Docs.remarks: The calculation of this track may be expensive, when the timespan between start and end is large or stepSize is small. Or when the timespan is far from the time the ship was last seen.
Docs.exception: Stepsize is to small or negative
Start time is after end time

static member RelativePositionsTo : Iot.Device.Nmea0183.Ais.Ship * seq<Iot.Device.Nmea0183.Ais.AisTarget> * DateTimeOffset * Iot.Device.Nmea0183.Ais.TrackEstimationParameters -> System.Collections.Generic.List<Iot.Device.Nmea0183.Ais.ShipRelativePosition>

Docs.param: The own ship
The list of visible AIS targets
The current time (or the time the data is valid for)
Parameters controlling the accuracy and speed of the calculation
Docs.summary: Calculates the relative positions and the collision vectors from one ship to a group of targets. The algorithm used is inspired by https://core.ac.uk/download/74237799.pdf
Docs.returns: A list of relative positions between our ship and the targets. Targets without a valid position are skipped.
Docs.exception: Our ship has no valid position

Docs.param: Our own vessel
The other ship or target (can also be a stationary target, such as an instance)
The time at which the comparison occurs. Typically now, but it is also possible to estimate the dangers at another time. When playing back old data, this must correspond to the playback time
The parameters used for the calculation
Docs.summary: Calculates the relative position data set to another vessel.
Docs.returns: An instance of with all possible fields filled out.
